Reviews.Title: “With this rate you can find much better options”
Reviews.Author: RaniaSaber
Reviews.Content: The hotel was bad with every thing. - we booked a double room and had a room with 3 small single beds. - dinner is poor and I had eyelashes in mt plate - bed sheets were dirty - we stayed for 4 nights and the room was cleaned 1 time only, and the toilet was not cleaned at all. - They have a massage chair at the reception which is great to use after a long day in Istanbul. - Next to the hotel there is a small shop (with very friendly brothers working there) where you can make cheap international phone calls. -The small supermarket next to the hotel is over priced, try to buy water or other things fro an other place.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Eliashage
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the hotel, it is an average hotel nice location.. verybad parking you have to pay 10$ for each night. the food is also bad not so variety. The location is near the grand bazaar you can go by walk its just 7 minutes away. concerning the rooms they are big and with balcony so i would recommend it if you like to sleep and go in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Can I give it a 3.5?”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on our group tour through Turkey and from reading the reviews, I was a bit worried. However, I have to disagree with many of the reviews. The only caveat that I give would be that perhaps I did not travel at the time of some of these problems. Additionally, the Turks are not necessarily known for customer service. As a result, I do not think any review that attempts to discount this hotel due to customer service should not be fully trusted. If one thinks that American or even Western European customer service exists in Istanbul, then they are sadly mistaken. The Good: I was very surprised by the cleanliness of the hotel lobby and the hotel itself. The pool was very small, but very nice. The "Secret Garden" as it was called by the hotel was very nice for a drink or hookah. The restaurant was very good, having a wide selection to choose from at dinner. We ate here 2 different days and the main course was very different each day. Free WiFi in the lobby was also a plus. Great location, only 10 minutes from some restaurants and shopping. 20-25 minutes to the main cultural areas of the Old Town. The Bad: Small rooms for singles. My other group members had bigger rooms with double beds, but be careful if you are a single traveler or if you book a double, it may be very small. The bathrooms needs some cleaning and updating. The Ugly: The mattresses were not very soft and the karaoke lady singing at 1a was not fun. I would stay here again if I had to, but with so many choices I would look around.

Reviews.Title: “the mix between 4* & 3*”
Reviews.Author: esham83
Reviews.Content: this hotel contains deluxe & standard rooms so when i entered this hotel i believed its 4* hotel very nice lobby very nice swimming pool but small but when i entered the room i disappointed the bed was not clean small window with ruins view but the room is wide enough breakfast is different & rich belong again to 4* staff are helpful but one of them is very rude he made me felt that i'm a prisoner not a tourist Tv is really bad & without remote control Ac is very strong this hotel should 've different prices one for standard & other for deluxe

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to be....”
Reviews.Author: kasiopi
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel in April 2011.I was surprised when I saw the differences between reality and what was served on the web site. If you are not a smuggler do not even think of staying in this hotel. Everything in this hotel is below any standard so think twice before deciding to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No towels????”
Reviews.Author: RetMarine
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into the hotel we all went to our separate rooms to clean up and get ready to go out for the evening. Automatically I went into the shower, but upon finishing with my ablutions found that what I thought was a towel on the towel rack was in fact the floor mat. Needless to say I had to use it to dry off as there was nothing else in the bathroom to use. I called the front desk to complain about the lack of towels and was reluctantly told that there would be someone there in a minute with fresh towels. As I left the room an hour later, there were still no towels. I mentioned this to the front desk as I left. Upon my return I noted that there were indeed what appeared to be towels hanging on the towel reck. Upon closer inspection I found that I now had two floor mats. Contacting the front desk again I asked for towels. An hour later when none were delivered I walked to the front desk and was told "Sorry sir, we are temporarily out of clean towels. We will send some to your room as soon as they are available." The next morning as I dried myself again on a floor mat I vowed never to return to this hotel. It was hot in the rooms, with no control other than opening a window which opened out to a loud loading dock for a company next door. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad smelling”
Reviews.Author: tornea_mihail
Reviews.Content: a very bad hotel with ill-mannered personnal. we made a booking via our travel agent, we looked at the pictures and we choosed this hotel, but when I saw the room I did not seen anything that looks like the photo. it waas dirty with bad furniture and bad smell. when I told them that the room do not correspond to the one that we booked they answered that such a room as in pictures costs 200 EURO pe night (stayed at Meryem with less)

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, clean and ... strange”
Reviews.Author: MarcinSteuer
Reviews.Content: The first thing that came to your mind when you enter the hotel is the fact, that it's made specially for Russians. Everything is made for their taste and majority of info is in russian. But nevertheless the hotel is worth for recommendation. Rooms are very clean, not big but big enough (I had 2 beds room). The bathroom was also clean - towels were changed every day. Breakfest is also good - there is a big variety of thins to choose from. Everything fresh and tasty. I would like to get there back someday...

Reviews.Title: “value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: HAMID84
Reviews.Content: It was an average value for money hotel . '" Gentle where necessary " . The hotel had a safe in reception where you can keep your passports etc . The breakfast in the morning was really good and ample in supply. The food was also of a good quality consists of Eggs , Milk , Jams , Jellys breads , cornflaks and different sorts of other cereals . No doubt rooms were very average , old n abit gloomy which can make you sleep early . How ever the location of the hotel was really good . It is situated in the famous area of aksary in the Europe side of Istanbul and it is famous for tourists. It has a good n clean swimming pool, turkish bath at night and internet facility in the lobby area!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Nisrinette
Reviews.Content: - The room is very tidy and clean. But we got a room with a window showing to a wall, no view at all - the room has dim light to the point making you feel sleepy - The bathroom door is so old, not painted, cracks are so obvious, it's swelled up due to humidity - the lobby is too small with old furnitures, there was no AC!!!! it was too hot. the sun warms up the room that you cannot bear to sit more than 10 minutes - Swimming pool is small, crowded, i never felt that i need to swim. Staff over there keep on staring on girls and following them with their eyes - Internet access is possible 1 LT - You can get food easily, there was many snacks and restaurants near - Location is good, you can find the old Mosque and it's garden few minutes near it. You can also discover the old city area in Laleli
